justification: The article states that Evidence Accumulation Models "make predictions about both the choices made and the time it takes them to make choices, so-called Choice-Response Time (choice-RT) data," indicating that researchers use choice-RT data to operationalize the underlying evidence-accumulation decision process.

The text notes that "the time required to complete the decision provides insight into the underlying decision process," giving the example that faster decisions reflect stronger preferences, thereby using response-time length as the observable measure of decision caution.
construct: Degree of caution in decisions (speed-accuracy trade-off)
